result.execSummary:
The defendant Sharod C Moore was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Sharod C Moore is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Sharod C Moore was found guilty of Manufacture/Deliver Cocaine (<=1g), a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(cm)1g.
  • Sharod C Moore was found guilty of Manufacture/Deliver Cocaine (<=1g), a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(cm)1g.
  • Sharod C Moore was found guilty of Manufacture/Deliver Cocaine (<=1g), a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(cm)1g.
  • Sharod C Moore was found guilty of Manufacture/Deliver Cocaine (<=1g), a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(cm)1g.
  • Sharod C Moore was found guilty of Maintain Drug Trafficking Place, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.42(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Racine County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 6 years bifurcated sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: Court costs are waived. Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law and must pay mandatory DNA surcharge.
Obtain and maintain full-time employment.
No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.
No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Do not associate with any known drug dealers or users.  Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.

Report to Racine Vocational Ministry. Be involved in cognitive therapy. If appropriate transition back through WCA. Firearm warning given.  Voting prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored. Obtain a valid drivers license. No contact with A.J. (person, property, residence or family). Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.

Count 2- 6 Years WPS, 2 Years init, 4 Years es, to run concurrent to count 1

Count 3- 6 Years WPS, 2 Years init, 4 Years es, to run concurrent to count 1 & 2

Count 4- 6 Years WPS, 2 Years init, 4 Years es, to run concurrent to count 1, 2 & 3

Count 5- Withheld sentence, 3 Years probation, to run consecutive to count 1, 2, 3 & 4

Report to Racine Vocational Ministry 
No drugs, no alcohol
Be involved in cognitive therapy
Obtain & maintain employment
If appropriate transition back through WCA

Keith O'Donnell
Defendant's
Preliminary hearing on May 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:   Defendant ordered not to possess or control any weapons.  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Sharod C Moore in court with attorney Nhu Huong Tran.  Defendant Sharod C Moore in custody.  Christopher D. Steenrod appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Mark Garvin.  Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.
